In 1946, the person in <image 1> was arrested for refusing to sit in the blacks-only section of the cinema in Nova Scotia. This is an example of______________.

A. A consensus crime
B. A conflict crime
C. A social deviation
D. A social diversion

C. A social deviation

The person in the image was arrested for refusing to sit in the blacks-only section of the cinema in Nova Scotia, which was a form of social deviation. This act was considered a social deviation because it challenged the established norms and practices of segregation in that era.
